text: - My name is Lou Kratz.
I'm a principal engineer at Bazaar Voice.

Generative AI is enabling
developers to move faster,

and realize their AI
prototypes at lightning speeds.

This isn't without
excessive risk, however,

because most developers
don't truly understand
how the AI works.
As a result, they don't know if their LLM
is correct, ethical, or safe.
This puts their products,

as well as their companies
at significant risk.
I think the biggest misconception
among the general public
is that large language models can think.

They can't, they can just
predict the next words,
or words that can come next.

You can see this when
you ask them to reason.

They'll often incorrectly
answer math questions
because they're not thinking about
the numbers that they're working with.
They're just predicting the words
that they think should come next.
At Bizarre Voice, we balance fast delivery

and safety of our generative
AI with a two-pronged approach.
First, while we're building the AI,
we use LLM evals to ensure
that our models are producing results
that meet our quality bar.

Second, when we deploy
those generative AI models,
we use guardrails on AWS to ensure
that they're not hallucinating.

AWS can support us on
our generative AI journey
by continuing to invest in Bedrock,
adding more foundational models

as they're released by
cutting edge companies
like philanthropic enables us

to use them without having
to develop that AI ourselves.
Continuing to expand Bedrock's features,
including support from multimodal models,

will enable us to create
new, innovative products

without having to do
that legwork ourselves.

AWS helps my software
company be more agile.

We can build on AWS tools
without reinventing the wheel,
to produce value added features.
(bright music)
